text.result:
The fastest animal on land is the cheetah, which can reach speeds of up to 70 miles per hour (113 kilometers per hour). However, if we consider all animals, including those in water and air, then:

*   The fastest animal in water is the sailfish, which can swim at speeds of over 68 miles per hour (110 kilometers per hour).
*   The fastest bird is the peregrine falcon, which can dive at speeds of up to 242 miles per hour (390 kilometers per hour) during its characteristic hunting stoop.
*   In the air, the fastest animal is the peregrine falcon's cousin, the golden eagle, but actually it is a bit slower than the peregrine.

*   The fastest animal in water is the sailfish, which can swim at speeds of over 68 miles per hour (110 kilometers per hour).

text.result:
In Europe, some of the fastest animals are:

*   The pronghorn's distant relative, the European roe deer, can run at speeds of up to 30-40 miles per hour (48-64 kilometers per hour).
*   The European rabbit is a fast runner as well and can reach speeds of around 25-30 miles per hour (40-48 kilometers per hour).

However, the fastest animal in Europe would likely be the European hare, which can run at speeds of up to 45 miles per hour (72 kilometers per hour).
